jed

Class KernelDensityEstimate2d

  • java.lang.Object
    • jed.BilinearSampler
      • jed.KernelDensityEstimate2d
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Function21

    public class KernelDensityEstimate2d
extends BilinearSampler
implements Function21
    So you've got some 2d points and you want to transform that into a probability distribution function. This class performs that task with a bivariate kernel density estimation algorithm. Essentially, each point is convolved with a kernel. Usually, the kernel is the normal function.

    The main difficulty here is selecting the bandwidth of the kernel. This class will do so automatically. For more information, see DiagonalBandwidthSelector2d.

    This implementation precomputes a table of the KDE PDF within some range. Values provided by this function are not exact, but a based on bilinear interpolation from this table.

    Author:
    Philip DeCamp

    • Method Detail

      • compute

        public static KernelDensityEstimate2d compute(double[] points,
                                              int off,
                                              int numPoints)
        Provides a 2D Kernel Density Estimate of a set of 2D points.
        Parameters:
        points - Array containing points: [x0, y0, x1, y1...]
        off - Offset into point array.
        numPoints - Number of points to use.
        Returns:
        New KernelDensityEstimate of the given data points.

      • compute

        public static KernelDensityEstimate2d compute(double[] points,
                                              int off,
                                              int numPoints,
                                              double[] bounds,
                                              java.lang.Double cellSize,
                                              Function21 kernel)
        Generates a 2D Kernel Density Estimate of a set of 2D points.
        Parameters:
        points - Array containing points: [x0, y0, x1, y1...]
        off - Offset into point array.
        numPoints - Number of points to use.
        bounds - Bounds over which the PDF table will be computed. (Optional)
        cellSize - Size of the side of each cell in table: IE, the sampling interval. (Optional)
        Use a low value for more approximate results, but faster initialization and less memory use.
        Use a high value for more accurate results, but slower initialization and more memory use.
        Use null to select a default cell size.
        kernel - Kernel function (Optional)
        Set to null to select a kernel automatically.
        Returns:
        New KernelDensityEstimate of the given data points.

      • selectBandwidth

        public static double[] selectBandwidth(double[] points,
                                       int off,
                                       int numPoints,
                                       double[] bounds2x2)
        Selects the bandwidth for a set of points. Pretty much just for convenience, so you won't have to look at DiagonalBandwidthSelector2d.
        Parameters:
        points - Array containing points: [x0, y0, x1, y1...]
        off - Offset into point array.
        numPoints - Number of points to use.
        bounds2x2 - Bounds being used for KDE function. (Optional)
        Returns:
        2x2 bandwidth matrix

      • selectKernel

        public static Function21 selectKernel(double[] bandWidth2x2)
        Creates a kernel. It's a normal function.
        Parameters:
        bandWidth2x2 - 2x2 Bandwidth matrix
        Returns:
        a normal kernel function.

      • selectBounds

        public static double[] selectBounds(double[] points,
                                    int off,
                                    int numPoints,
                                    double margin)
        Selects bounds for a set of points. Recommended margin is 0.25.
        Parameters:
        points - Array containing points: [x0, y0, x1, y1...]
        off - Offset into point array.
        numPoints - Number of points to use.
        margin - Margin around points, in units of the span of the points.
        Returns:
        4x1 matrix [minX, minY, maxX, maxY]

      • kernel

        public Function21 kernel()
        Returns:
        Kernel used by this KernelDensityEstimate to generate PDF table.
